items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.13 submission and recommendation: 
Article 9.13 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.13 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $86,000 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of May 10, 2015 through June 9, 2015 as noted in the attached documents.
items.item_text: Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 10. Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions

items.item_details:
The District receives funding from the State for physical improvements to the campuses in the form of Energy Efficiency Projects (Prop 39) and Scheduled Maintenance allocations.  For Fiscal Year 14-15, the combined allocation for these projects was approximately $1.6M.  To provide project management support for these projects, the District retained Gilbane Building Company in 2014.  The subject ICA provides for the completion of projects in the summer of 2015.  The specific projects are outlined in Exhibit A of the agreement.  
	 
Additionally, the subject ICA provides for facilities management services, as needed, until the District hires a new Director of Facilities, and for project management services for other work with funding sources other than the Measure G Bonds.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) in the amount of $171,862.00 to Gilbane Building Company to provide project management services for State funded projects, as well as certain facilities management services.
items.item_text: Project and Facilities Management Services – Gilbane Building Company Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA)
items.item_text_raw: 11. Project and Facilities Management Services – Gilbane Building Company Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA)

Being submitted for Board approval is Amendment No. 12, which extends the Master Agreement through June 30, 2016.

items.item_details:
Elevators and wheelchair lifts at all locations in the district are maintained and repaired by an outside service contractor, whose contract is managed by the District Maintenance office.  The service contractor is responsible to assure that all elevator hoistways, cabs, pits and machine rooms are in safe and reliable operation, and in compliance with all State regulations.  There are currently 31 elevators and wheelchair lifts in the District.  This quantity will increase as additional new buildings open in 2016 and beyond.  
	 
District staff prepared a request for bid proposals to select a single elevator service contractor.   Cost proposals were based upon unit costs for each elevator or lift.    Annual escalation clauses and hourly rates for emergency services, which are typical for elevator service contracts, were also included in the bids.  
	 
On March 3, 2015, the bid advertisement was posted on the District website and sent to eight (8) qualified service providers.  On April 9, 2015, unit price bids were received from four qualified companies.  Unit price bids were applied to the quantity of elevators and lifts in the District, and the approximate cost for the first year of service for each company is as follows: 
	 
KONE                                              $   70,200.00
Otis Elevator Company                   $  108,300.00
Schindler Elevator Corporation        $   61,848.00 (x3)
ThyssenKrupp Elevator Corporation $  69,552.00
	 
The contractor selection process also included evaluation of the contractor's experience, qualifications, location and level of service, as well as reference calls to other clients.  After review of all of these criteria, the selection committee unanimously agreed to recommend Schindler Elevator Corporation.  
	 
The contract agreement will be for three years, with up to two annual renewals, for a maximum total of five (5) years.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an ICA an amount not to exceed $61,848 annually for a period of three years with two optional one-year extensions.
items.item_text: Award of Elevator Service contract to Schindler Elevator Corporation
items.item_text_raw: 14. Award of Elevator Service contract to Schindler Elevator Corporation

items.item_details:
San Jose City College wishes to establish an agreement to partner with Estrella Family Services, a California nonprofit charitable public benefit corporation (hereafter "Sub-Contractor").  SJCC has found the Sub-Contractor able to meet the needs of the Child Development Division, California Department of Education (CDE) for state child development program services for both toddler and preschool care.
	 
As the certified CDC contractor, SJCC will conduct fiscal agent responsibilities and compliance checks to meet the conditions of its contract with the California Department of Education, Child Development Division and to adhere to the Funding Terms and Conditions (FT&C).
	 
SJCC recommends to the Board of Trustees to approve the Independent Contractor Agreement with Estrella Family Services, for fiscal year 2015-2016, in the amount of $301,940.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation to the Board of Trustees to approve the Independent Contractors Agreement with Estrella Family Services, for fiscal year 2015-2016.

items.item_details: The San Jose Evergreen Community College District is a member of the South Bay Regional Public Safety Training Consortium (SBRPSTC) Joint Powers Authority (JPA).  The purpose of the SBRPSTC is to provide training and educational programs that are responsive to the needs of regional public safety agencies.  The SBRPSTC is governed by a Board of Directors.  As stated in Section II.A. of the Public Safety Training Consortium JPA Agreement Bylaws, the Board of Directors consist of one representative and one alternate from each member community college district who are appointed by the Governing Board of the member college district.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees designate the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services as the District's alternate representative to the South Bay Regional Public Safety Training Consortium Joint Powers Authority

items.item_details: EVC will participate as a strategic partner with Generations and provide infrastructure for the Certified Nursing Assistant Program.  EVC will provide certificated faculty to teach a small cohort of students for lecture/lab.  EVC will facilitate this cohort in the administration and certification of state testing for the Certified Nursing Assistant Exam.  Generations will financially support this pilot for the Summer of 2015.

items.item_details:
Following approval by the Board of Trustees on December 13, 2011, the District entered into a one-year agreement with A. Plescia & Co. in the amount of $75,000 effective January 19, 2012 to provide consulting services related to the planned development of the land adjacent to the Evergreen Valley College campus.  The agreement was extended an additional year beginning January 19, 2013, and a $20,000 increase was approved by the Board of Trustees July 9, 2013.  An amendment approved by the Board of Trustees on February 11, 2014 extended the term to January 17, 2015 with an increase of $18,000.  An amendment approved by the Board of Trustees on May 13, 2014 increased the amount to $130,000.
	 
The attached Amendment #4 is to cover additional costs related to Task 4, over and above the work items set forth in the approved Scope of Work, and to provide adequate funding to complete Task 5.  The additional Task 4 costs are related to the preparation and negotiations of the draft non-binding letter of intent (LOI), including participation in additional meetings and preparation of District staff recommendations for review and consideration by the Board of Trustees, as well as attendance at additional meetings of the Board of Trustees.
	 
Upon approval by the Board of Trustees, the agreement with A. Plescia and Co. will be increased by $12,000 for a total of $142,000.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Amendement #4 to the agreement with A. Plescia & Co., an independent contractor providing consulting services related to land development, increasing the amount by $12,000 for a total of $142,000.
items.item_text: Amendment #4 to the Land Development Consulting Agreement with A. Plescia & Co.
items.item_text_raw: 20. Amendment #4 to the Land Development Consulting Agreement with A. Plescia & Co.

items.item_details:
This study abroad trip to Cuba will grant an opportunity to travel abroad to those who might not otherwise have such an opportunity.  This includes economically disadvantaged students, students of color, and students who are single parents in the San Jose Evergreen Community College District.  The primary objective is to globalize their understanding of the western world historically, culturally, geographically, and economically. Students will be required to register in 3-units of college coursework (i.e. African American Literature or Introduction to Ethnic Studies) during the summer of 2015.  Prior to the trip, students will receive lectures on world history, global economics and geography.  While on the study abroad tour students will receive a number of lectures and field study projects from university faculty.
	 
The following students will be participating in the study abroad trip to Cuba:
	 
Tasean Clark - EVC
Audreya DeShazier - EVC
Kenny Jackson - EVC
Nancy Macias - SJCC/EVC
Derrick Newton - EVC
Darrell Parker-Rogers - EVC
Sophia Said - EVC
Jocelyne Salazar - EVC
Yesenia Santos - EVC
Chris Sifflet - SJCC
Henry Louis Simmons - SJCC/EVC
Christine Tellez - EVC
	 
The students will leave for Cuba Saturday, July 25, 2015, returning on Wednesday, August 5, 2015. The estimated cost for travel is $31,850.00 ($2,450 per person).  Each student has paid half of their travel fee and the remaining funds have been raised. 
	 
Students will be accompanied by Evergreen Valley College faculty members, Keenan Norris, Flora Payne, Charlie Kahn-Lomax, and Alexandria White, and they will each cover the cost of their own travel.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of country travel to Cuba for students and faculty.
items.item_text: Student Out of Country Travel - Study Abroad Trip to Cuba
items.item_text_raw: 21. Student Out of Country Travel - Study Abroad Trip to Cuba

items.item_details:
The SJCC International Student Program is requesting Board approval to participate in overseas travel recruitment to Asia to increase international student enrollment as it will benefit our campus, and District, educationally and culturally. For the past few decades, San Jose City College (SJCC) has successfully accommodated international students in our comprehensive one-stop program.  With the growing trend to attract students to study at community colleges in the U.S., SJCC has the goal of becoming one of the premier institutions for international students in the Bay Area. Furthermore, this initiative is a part of the on-going effort to internationalize the college (e.g. study abroad opportunities).
	 
Staff attending will be: Doriann Tran, SJCC International Counselor/Coordinator; Roland Montemayor, SJCC Dean of Counseling; and Byron Clift Breland, SJCC President
	 
Proposed dates out of country recruitment activities are (10/16/2015 Departureâ 11/1/2015 Return)
Cities visited will include: 10/19 Jakarta, 10/21 Bangkok, 10/23 Hanoi, 10/24 Ho Chi Minh, 10/27 Shanghai; and 10/30-10/31 Ho Chi Minh.   Presentations will include high level administration, parents and student groups. SJCC recruitment efforts will include: agent expos; education briefings; student events and school visits.
Recruitment and fair participation is the most viable option for San Jose City College to gain visibility and credibility as the college is entering the recruitment arena for the first time.  San Jose City College has selected to participate in the Asia recruitment events offered through International Student Network (ISN) and Vietnam Education & Training Center (VETEC) due to the high demand in Asia to study in the United States.  China and Vietnam are in the top five countries with international students studying at a U.S. community college. ISN is a reputable agency established in 2000 that provides recruitment events such as visits to local schools, college student fairs, and agent workshops. 
Our location in Silicon Valley offers a unique opportunity to brand our college overseas as a gateway to Silicon Valley and the Bay Area; as well as provide our students with an opportunity to study with and interact with others from around the world.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of country travel to Asia for recruitment purposes.
items.item_text: SJCC Overseas Recruitment: Fall 2015
items.item_text_raw: 22. SJCC Overseas Recruitment: Fall 2015

items.item_details:
On April 2, 2015, the California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office formally notified it's districts and colleges within the system of the requirement "that each college develop, adopt and post a goals framework as mandated by recently enacted legislation."  Education Code section 84754.6 established a new system of indicators and goals intended to encourage colleges to adopt and institutional effectiveness plan that includes measuring IE metrics based upon targets set by the institution.  The Board of Governors adopted this goals framework at its March 16, 2015 meeting.  Pursuant to the Student Success and Support Program and in order to continue receiving funds from such, each college must adopt goals in the following four areas:  student performance and outcomes; accreditation status, fiscal viability, and programmatic compliance with state and federal guidelines.  The Chancellor's office is requiring that the goals within this framework be locally determined and posted to the IEPI portal according to deadlines set by the BOG.  
		 
For this first year, the Chancellor's Office will require districts to adopt only four goals: Course Completion Rate; Accreditation Status; Fund Balance; and Overall Audit Opinion.  SJECCD has chosen to be proactive and report goals in all required AND optional areas within the framework.  After a thorough vetting through the constituencies at each college as well as the district office, the IEPI goals for SJECCD, Evergreen Valley College, and San Jose City College for all required and optional indicators have been determined and is attached.  The Board is required to adopt these indicators each year.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt metrics for the Institutional Effectiveness Partnership Initiative as required by the California Community Colleges Chancellors Office in compliance with the Student Success and Support Program.
items.item_text: Approval of the Institutional Effectiveness Partnership Initiative Indicators for SJCC, EVC, and District
items.item_text_raw: 23. Approval of the Institutional Effectiveness Partnership Initiative Indicators for SJCC, EVC, and District

items.item_details:
Assembly Bill 1433 (signed into law 9/30/14) mandates that all Colleges, by July 1, 2015, adopt and implement written policies and procedures to ensure that any report of a Part 1 violent crime, sexual assault or hate crime is forwarded to the appropriate law enforcement agency without identifying the victim.  
	 
The attached board policy is in line with this legal mandate and submitted to the Board as a final read (having been presented as a first read at the June 9, 2015, board meeting). This policy, along with the accompanying administrative procedure, was presented to District Council and shared with constituent groups with final feedback received on May 13, 2015.  
	 
The included administrative procedure is provided to the board for information only, not for review, as the board approves board policies and the Chancellor approves administrative procedures. 
	 
BP 3540 is presented with a recommendation for approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 3450.
items.item_text: Board Policy & Administrative Procedure 3540: Sexual and Other Assaults on Campus
items.item_text_raw: 24. Board Policy & Administrative Procedure 3540: Sexual and Other Assaults on Campus

items.item_details:
On August 4, 2014 the Board of Trustees agreed to enter into contract with Consolidated Engineering Services (CEL) for Special Testing and Inspection services for the Automotive Technology project at Evergreen Valley College.  
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No.001 includes additional welding inspection, structural steel inspection, concrete mix design review, and rebar inspection.  CEL submitted a written price proposal for changes that include additional work.  The proposal has been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
This ICA revision results in an addition to the contact in the amount of $27,052.  This change will be funded from the project contingency established in the project budget.
           
Original Contract Amount            $  82,948
Previous Approved Revisions      $  0
This Revision No. 001                  $  27,052
Total Contract and Changes        $110,000
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No.001 in the amount of $27,052 to Consolidated Engineering Laboratories (CEL) for Testing and Inspection Services for the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111, Consolidated Engineering Laboratories Independent Contractor agreement (ICA) Revision No. 001

items.item_details:
On November 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to C. Overaa & Company in the amount of $11,347,704 to provide construction services for the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College.  
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 004 includes the extension of existing fiber/copper communication lines into the building, revisions to exterior sunshade louver supports, changing the make/model of the air handler variable frequency drives and exterior bollards / detectable warning surfaces to match District Standards, and a credit to revise the toilet partition material to a more durable product.  
	 
C. Overaa & Company submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the Agenda attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, overhead, and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                      $11,347,704
Previous Approved Changes                $     430,317
Change Order No. 004                         $       46,937   
Total Contract and Changes                 $11,824,958
	 
The net change to C. Overaa & Company's contract as a result of all changes issued is $477,254, which equates to 4.21% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 004 in the amount of $46,937 to C. Overaa & Company for the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.

On February 25, 2013 the Board of Trustees agreed to enter into contract with URS Corporation for Geotechnical services for the Automotive Technology Project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Note – The original ICA was with URS Corporation, which was purchased by AECOM.  This revision and all future ICA revisions will be with AECOM. 
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No. 005 is a no cost time extension.  All original contract requirements remain unchanged with the exception of the revised duration of June 30, 2016.  
	 
The previous ICA amendment increased the contract value to be based on the final programmed project cost.  The item in the amendment results in an addition of the contract of $0.
           
Original Contract Amount              $ 74,416
Previous Approved Revisions       $ 45,584
This Revision No. 005                   $ 0         
Total Contract and Changes         $120,000

items.item_details:
On May 9, 2012, the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Lionakis for architectural design, construction administration and closeout services for the Automotive Technology Building project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Project Assignment Amendment No. 006 provides design for provisions which will facilitate the design of clean-out valves for the existing Heating and Cooling hydronic piping at Evergreen Valley College.  The design will focus on providing a means of access to the existing hydronic lines so that they may be flushed to remove sediment.  
	 
Services include providing plan drawings with applicable details and specifications for a 75% draft for review, followed by 100% finalized plans, signed and stamped by a Mechanical Engineer.  
	 
Lionakis submitted a written price proposal for this change that includes additional work.  The proposal has been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The previous PAA amendment increased the design value to be based on the final programmed project cost.  The item in this amendment results in an add to the contract of $8,300.
	 
Original Contract Amount                  $   668,350
Previous Approved Revisions            $   332,995
This Revision No. 006                        $       8,300
Total Contract and Changes              $1,009,645
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision No. 006 to Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01 in the amount of $8,300 to Lionakis for the Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.

On May 13, 2014 the Board of Trustees agreed to enter into contract with Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. for special testing and inspection services for the South Campus Development Project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No.001 includes additional welding inspection, concrete testing, in plant fabrication, weekend work & travel.  Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. was requested to provide additional services outside the Terms of their ICA in order to maintain construction progress.  Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. submitted a written proposal for changes that include additional work.  The proposal has been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
There are no previous revisions to this ICA to date and no future revisions are anticipated at this time.  The added services result in an increase to the original contract in the amount of $82,160.00.  This change will be funded from the project contingency established in the project budget.
           
Original Contract Amount            $140,000.00
Previous Approved Revisions     $           0.00
This Revision No. 001                 $  82,160.00
Total Contract and Changes       $222,160.00
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No. 001 in the amount of $82,160.00 to Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. for additional special testing and inspection services for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.

On August 26, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved an Agreement to Blach Construction Company in the amount of $41,639,729 to provide construction services for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District request design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 008 includes Work of adding:  isolation valves for building and equipment maintenance, casework revisions, fire smoke dampers, gutters and downspouts, and credits for added special inspections of structural steel and deleted/reduced electrical Work.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.  
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $41,639,729.00
Previous Approved Changes               $     442,878.85
Change Order No. 008                        $         7,392.15
Total Contract and Changes               $42,090,000.00
	 
The net change to Blach Construction Company’s contract as a result of all changes issued is $450,271.00 which equates to 1.08% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from the project contingency established in the project budget.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 008 in the amount of $7,392.15 to Blach Construction Company for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
Andrea Johnson of KRJ Design (the furniture consultant) worked with the users to identify specifications and select product.  The District issued for bid the fixed table furniture in the three tiered lecture rooms of the South Campus Development Project.  Utilizing the public bidding process, the District advertised the Project in local papers on June 8th and again on June 15, 2015.  In addition, invitations to Bid were sent to over 81 vendors and also to the area plan rooms. 
	 
By June 24, 2015 at 3:00PM the District received three (3) bid proposals:
Sierra School Equipment               $149,088.00
Krueger International                     $  97,188.99
Sedia Systems Inc.                        $  74,135.00 
	 
The proposals consisted of company portfolios, required forms, acknowledgements of the Addendums, shop drawings (if applicable), warranty information, business and contractor licensing, bid price and an add alternate for installation by a preferred installer.
	 
On June 25, 2015 the Selection Committee (which included the Furniture Consultant, District Purchasing, and College Deans) evaluated and approved the proposed alternate product to be supplied by the low bidder, Sedia Systems Inc.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of an Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) to Sedia Systems Inc., in the amount of $ 74,135.00, for the supply and installation of the fixed table furniture in the three (3) tiered lecture rooms of the South Campus Development Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Sedia Systems Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Furniture Contract Award
items.item_text_raw: 8. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Sedia Systems Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Furniture Contract Award

items.item_details:
This project will upgrade the existing Refrigerant Monitoring System (RMS) that is beyond its useful life.  The RMS monitors and detects hazardous gas leaks from the chillers in the Central Plant.  The Board has previously approved a contract to Salas O’Brien to provide design services for the RMS Upgrade Project.
	 
The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website, advertised in local papers on June 1, 2015 and June 8, 2015 and published at local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to contractors including small, minority and woman-owned firms.  On July 2, 2015, construction bids were received from the 2 pre-qualified General Contractors for the RMS Upgrade project.  Base bids were received as follows:
	 
Bay Point Controls, Inc.           $20,672.00
Johnson Controls, Inc.             $57,198.43
	 
Bay Point Controls, Inc. from San Leandro was determined to be the lowest responsive and responsible bidder in the amount of $20,672.
	 
The District has not received any bid protests.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of a Construction Contract Agreement in the amount of $20,672 to Bay Point Controls, Inc. for the Refrigerant Monitoring Upgrade (RMS) Project #39311 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G –2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Refrigerant Monitoring System (RMS) Upgrade Project #39311 – Bay Point Controls, Inc. Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 9. Measure G –2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Refrigerant Monitoring System (RMS) Upgrade Project #39311 – Bay Point Controls, Inc. Agreement

items.item_details:
It is required by the Division of the State Architect (DSA) to have DSA approved inspector to ensure compliance with DSA requirements on the project.  The District issued an RFP for Inspector of Record Services (IOR) for the SJCC Physical Education Building/New Gym Site work and Auxiliary Buildings. 
	 
On June 11, 2015 the District received nine (9) proposals in response to the RFP.  The proposals were evaluated by a committee including representatives of District Purchasing and Gilbane.  Proposals were evaluated on the criteria of qualifications and references of the on-site inspector, availability of personnel, position rates & proposed fees, and interviews. 
	 
On June 24, 2015, three (3) selected firms were interviewed by the selection committee.  Gilbane facilitated the interviews.  The interview committee evaluated the selected firms based on best value. Santa Clara Valley Construction Inspections was determined to be the best value proposal in the amount of $237,800 and thus is recommended as IOR for the SJCC Physical Education/New Gym Site work and Auxiliary Buildings project.
	 
	 
	 
Santa Clara Valley Construction Inspectors              $237,800
                  DSA School of Inspectors LLC                                  $318,000          
         Structure Consultants Group                                     $360,400          
CIS Inc.                                                                      $227,800 (Does not include Assistant IOR required by DSA)
         Furman & Associates                                                $231,840 (Non-Responsive)
         Hayer Consultants Inc.                                              $237,600 (Non-Responsive)
         4LEAF Inc.                                                                 $277,095
         TYR                                                                           $316,240
         Apex Testing Laboratories Inc.                                  $318,927
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of a contract in the amount of $237,800 to Santa Clara Valley Construction Inspections, for the New Gym Site work and Auxiliary Buildings (PE Bldg.) #31125 at San Jose City College (SJCC).

items.item_details:
On February 11, 2014, the Board agreed to enter into a contract with CampusWorks per Bid Proposal G21010.0069 Ellucian Colleague Conversion to MS SQL (B0011261). This change order to the Independent Contractor Agreement is to provide additional Project Management services for the remaining technical projects necessary to complete the Oracle to Microsoft SQL Conversion for the Ellucian Colleague system. 
	 
The additional PM services are needed because the previous CampusWorks consultant's contract expired on June 30, 2015, the Director of Enterprise Application services remains unfilled and the scope of the project was increased when Ellucian required an intermediate staging server in the conversion process.
	 
The project management services will be provided remotely for 80 hours per month from July 2015 to January 31, 2016 at a cost of $175 per hour for a total cost of $98,000 (560 hours). 
	 
Original Contract Amount:      $2,678,562.50
Change Order #001                $     98,000.00
Total Contract and Changes   $2,776,562.50
	 
The total change order percentage is 3.66% of the base contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001 to the CampusWorks ICA in the amount of $98,000 for additional Project Management services for the Colleague Conversion to MS SQL at the District Office.

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Department of Education, Student Support Services Program Grant, P042A100225-14, awarded to Evergreen Valley College for a five year cycle, which  commenced September 1, 2010 is due to terminate on Monday, August 31, 2015. EVC attempts to renew the grant for another five year cycle were unsuccessful. Therefore preparations to close down the program are currently underway. Preparations include notification to personnel, student participants, preparation of fiscal report, conduct inventory of equipment and supplies and dispose in accordance to Department of Education regulations.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 071415-6 Eliminate Position and Layoff Classified Employee

items.item_details:
The District is required to submit, on an annual basis, a Five Year Capital Outlay Plan to the State Chancellor's Office that summarizes the current and proposed construction projects.  This plan includes all State and locally funded capital construction projects the District will be working on in the next five year period (2017-2021), and is submitted electronically before July 1.  A copy of the submitted plan is attached.  The plan is required to be adopted by the Board of Trustees.
	 
The current Plan includes a FPP (Final Project Proposal) for Evergreen Valley College identified as #32106 - Engineering and Applied Technology.  This project was initiated in 2010 as a replacement building for Roble and Acacia buildings, and requires a 1:1 match of local funds.  The EVC Measure G-2010 Bond List includes $9.7M as the matching fund source.   However, this project was not included in the Governor's list of planned projects for a State Bond in 2016.  
	 
During the current process of developing an updated Facilities Master Plan for EVC, it has become apparent that the academic program for this project has changed.  The modifications to the programming and scope of the future building, which are now being assessed and quantified, are significant enough to require the District to submit a new Initial Project Proposal (IPP) to the State Chancellor's Office.  This new IPP, and any other new projects resulting from the current master planning process, will be submitted in next year's Five Year Capital Outlay Plan (2017-2022).     The attached letter was submitted to the State Chancellor's Office, at their request.  
	 
In the meantime, the current Plan includes the previously submitted Engineering and Applied Technology Building.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the Five Year Capital Outlay Plan for the period 2017-2021, as required by the State Chancellor's Office as a provision under Community College Construction Act (California Education Code Section 81800).
items.item_text: Five Year Capital Outlay Plan for 2017 - 2021
items.item_text_raw: 6. Five Year Capital Outlay Plan for 2017 - 2021

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Education Code 81378.1, the Board of Trustees may lease district property for a period of no more than five years through direct negotiation with interested parties after a declaration of its intent to lease real property. The lease follows the college's finding that the property is not needed for academic activities and will contain a 60 day renegotiation/cancellation clause to protect the college should it find that the property is needed for academic activities in the future.
	 
Since 2010, Sharon Yang, dba Empire Montessori School, has leased the Child Development Center facility at EVC for $2,067 per month, the maximum rate allowed at the time that lease was executed.  Subsequently, the law has changed and requires that a community college district lease such property for "fair market value".
	 
Administration has published, for three consecutive weeks in the Daily Journal and on the District website, the intent to lease this property.  There have been no comments or questions raised from this public notice.
	 
District staff and Ms. Yang have mutually agreed that the current Fair Market Value for rental of the  facility is $6,392 per month, plus the pro-rata share of actual utilities costs.  The draft lease agreement is attached.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that that the Board of Trustees lease the facility known as the Child Development Center, Building # 8, to Sharon Yang, dba Empire Montessori School, for a period not to exceed five years, and authorize staff to execute and administer the lease.

items.item_details: Pursuant to a recommendation by the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges, Western Association of Schools and Colleges, at its June 3-5, 2015 meeting and based upon evidence submitted by each college in their Follow-up Report of March 2015, San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College have been removed from Probation.  In addition, both colleges are fully accredited.  This item is submitted for information to the Board in compliance with ACCJC dissemination requirements which include College faculty & staff, campus leadership, and the Board of Trustees.  The official letters are attached to this item to be submitted as a part of the official record.

items.item_details:
On July 8, 2014 the Board of Trustees approved the Contractor Outreach Consulting Services contract (7.8.2014 Board Agenda Item I-2) between L. Luster & Associates, the lead organization for the collaborative between LLA and Enterprise Foundation, and the District for the period from July 9, 2014 through June 30, 2015 in an amount not to exceed $311,845 to provide the following outreach services:
	 
1. Market research (identification and data collection) about local businesses and their readiness to perform work
2. Metrics development for measuring and evaluating our outreach efforts
3. Community outreach to introduce SJECCD to the region, make our business opportunities known, and build relationships with local businesses
4. Coaching, training, and preparation opportunities for local businesses, and
5. Project progress and results reporting and recommendations for continuing improvement of the outreach program
	 
L. Luster & Associates (LLA) and Enterprise Foundation were the two recommended organizations out of five organizations that submitted proposals in response to the Request for Qualifications & Proposal G2010.0089 - Contractor Outreach Consulting Services with the due date of April 30, 2014 (http:www.sjeccd.edu/Bids/Pages/RFQ-G2010-0089-Contractor-Outreach-Consulting-SErvices.aspx).  An evaluation committee representing well-respected community leaders made the recommendation for these two organizations to collaborate, with LLA as the lead organization, to achieve the District's outreach goal of increasing the contractor/vendor participation rate to 15 percent for diverse small business which would include minority-owned, women-owned, and disabled veteran-owned businesses to conduct business with the District's G-2010 bond and other non-bond projects and services (Board-approved "Local Business Outreach Program for Minority-Owned Enterprise (MBE), Women-Owned Enterprise (WBE), and Small Business Outreach Plan" - 9.13.2011 Board Agenda Item I-4).
	 
As part of the reporting component of the contract, L.Luster & Associates provided progress reports to the Board of Trustees at regular Board meetings on November 11, 2014 and February 10, 2015.  At the July 14, 2015 Board meeting, LLA will present the final report for this Contractor Outreach Consulting Services contract covering the period from July 9, 2014 with the ending date of June 30, 2015.

items.item_details: Evergreen Valley Collegeâs Student Success and Equity committee will be presenting on the 2014-2015 successful implementation and outcomes of services and events that support the Student Success, Equity and Basic Skills Plans. The presentation will include an overview of initiatives that directly meet and support Student Success Mandates and Equity Goals.  Campus-wide events such as Know Your Steps to Success, Days at the Green and more will be highlighted.  Programs such as Basic Skills, Foster Youth, Veterans and OASISS will be included along with Student Success Ambassador testimonials. The presentation will conclude with future plans for 2015-2016.

items.item_details: Each month, the Board will review the Global Ends Policy Dashboard.  This month the areas of Career Development, Transferability, and College Readiness remain stable.  Institutional Effectiveness shows improvement but some metrics still need to obtain baseline data.  The overall Global Ends Policy receives a rating of "B".

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
	 
The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
	 
1.To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
	 
2.To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
